lines.text: This is Afghanistan... Alexander the Great try to conquer this country... then Genghis Khan, then the British. Now Russia. But Afghan people fight hard, they never be defeated. Ancient enemy make prayer about these people... you wish to hear?
Very good. It says, 'May God deliver us from the venom of the Cobra, teeth of the tiger, and the vengeance of the Afghan.' Understand what this means?
That you guys don't take any shit?
You taught us to ignore pain, right?
Not really. Don't take it personal.
Are you insane? One man against trained commandos... Who do you think this man is? God?
No. God would have mercy. He won't.

[over the chopper's radio]
Drop your weapons! Now! You have no chance of escape! Come forward! I wish to take you back alive! This is your last warning! The choice is yours!
I'm sorry I got you into this Johnny.
[Rambo and Colonel Trautman stand alone facing an enemy army]
[after barely escaping the explosion of a fuel bomb dropped by a helicopter]
That was close John. How are you?
You expect sympathy? You started this damn war! Now you'll have to deal with it!
And we will. It is just a matter of time before we achieve a complete victory.

Yeah, well, there won't be a victory! Every day, your war machines lose ground to a bunch of POORLY-armed, POORLY-equipped freedom fighters! The fact is that you underestimated your competition. If you'd studied your history, you'd know that these people have never given up to anyone. They'd rather DIE, than be slaves to an invading army. You can't defeat a people like that. We tried! We already had our Vietnam! Now you're gonna have yours!
You do not look like men Griggs sent before. You not look like you are with military.
You're not with military, not mercenary - what you are? Lost tourist?

[as Rambo prepares to play Afghan game 'buzkashi']
God must love crazy people.
He make so many of them!
Cause he'd do it for me.
Now you see how it is here. Somewhere in the war there's supposed to be honor. Where's the honor here? Where? Now, we're taking the survivors to the border. Are you coming?
Have you not seen enough death? Go! Go while you can! This isn't your war.
So be it. You're a good friend.
The Kremlin's got a hell of a sense of humor.
You talk peace and disarmament. And here you are wiping out a race of people!

Let me tell you a story, John. There was a sculptor. He found this stone, a special stone. He dragged it home and he worked on it for months until he finally finished it. When he was ready he showed it to his friends. They said he had created a great masterpiece, but the sculptor said he hadn't created anything. The statue was always there, he just chipped away the rough edges. You're always going to be tearing away at yourself until you come to terms with who you are. Until you come full circle.
Rambo, I do not know who you are yet. But by the way you look, you don't have any experience in war, do you? C'mon, do you?

[laughing at Rambo]
A few shots? Come on! Maybe you should go back home and think it all over again, for a very long time!

[walks over to Mousa Ghani]
I did think it over.
You did? Well, this is your choice. But let me tell you, you cannot get the American alone. If you fail not blame me, I will accept no responsibility.
